section.h2: Top played tracks from the last month

section.div: Favorites genres: Action, Comedy, Fantasy, Drama, Romance

div.div:
I, the protagonist, was just an ordinary high school girl, but suddenly I was reincarnated as a spider monster in a fantasy world. Not only that, but I awakened in a dungeon filled with vicious monsters. Armed with only my human knowledge and my overwhelming positivity, I'm forced to use spiderwebs and traps to defeat far stronger monsters just to stay alive... So begins the labyrinth survival story of a girl with incredible mental strength living as one of the lowest-ranked beasts!
(Source: Crunchyroll)

When his father remarries, Yuta Asamura winds up sharing a roof with his new stepsister, Saki Ayase, the hottest girl in his grade. Carrying the scars of their parentsâ€™ troubled divorces, they vow to maintain a respectful distance. But what starts as cautious camaraderie blossoms into something deeper from shared experiences. Is it admiration, familial love, or something more? (Source: Crunchyroll)
Comedy, Psychological, Romance, Slice of Life, Supernatural

One sleepless night, Ko slips out to walk the streets. Life after dark is a revelation! When flirtatious Nazuna invites Ko to spend the night at her place in an abandoned building, heâ€™s stoked! But then he awakens to kisses on his neck with a little too much bite to them... Is it just the delicious taste of his blood that makes her meet him night after night for late-night adventures, conversation and...naps? Or something else? Then, when a cute girl from Koâ€™s past shows up and competes for his attention, his budding relationship with the undead is put to the test! (Source: Viz Media) Notes: - Seventh place of Tsugimanga 2020 Award in the Manga Category and first place of Daruma 2023 Award (France) in the new manga category (released in 2022 in France). - Includes three extra chapters.
Watashi no Oshi wa Akuyaku Reijou.

The story of a reincarnated gamer pursuing her villainous lady love at a fantasy girlsâ€™ academy!
Ordinary office worker Oohashi Rei has just woken up in the body of the protagonist of her favorite girlsâ€™ otome game, Revolution. To her delight, the first person to greet her is her favorite character, Claire Francoisâ€“who just so happens to be the main antagonist of the story. Now, Rei is determined to do what the game never allowed: romance Claire instead of one of the male leads. But how will her villainous lady love react to that?!
(Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)
How do you use Aeron MDS with multiple publishers and a single subscriber where the publishers are unaware of the subscriber machine IPs?

I am trying to use Aeron Multi-Destination-Subscriptions where I have multiple publishers publish messages to their own IP address and port. I want a subscriber to subscribe to each of the publishers IP addresses and PORTs on the same stream ID. The publishers and subscribers are on separate machines. For simplicity, I'm testing this with a single Publisher and Subscriber setup. I am using docker to create a virtual network so I can designate the IPs of the publisher and subscriber machines. Here is my example code: Publication code final String publicationChannel = new ChannelUriStringBuilder() .media(UDP_MEDIA) (3 more lines were trimmed) Subscription code final String subscriptionChannel = new ChannelUriStringBuilder() .media(UDP_MEDIA) (8 more lines were trimmed) I have a doWork in both of these which repeatedly call subscription.isConnected() and publication.isConnected(). I expected this to work just like the MDC example where you can use control-mode=manual on the publication side and call publication.addDestination(subscriberIP:port) where the subscription would be setup to subscribe to its own subscriberIP:port. In testing, the publication and subscription are not connected. This test class in the aeron repo uses MDS over UDP using localhost and using multicast addresses MDSTest so I thought the same would hold true for using the publisher machines IP and port. Would really appreciate if someone could explain why this doesn't work?
